questions.question: What does CSS stand for?
questions.explanation: CSS stands for Cascading Style Sheets, which is a stylesheet language used to describe the presentation of a document written in HTML or XML.

questions.question: Which HTML tag is used to link an external CSS file?
questions.explanation: The `<link>` tag is used in the HTML document's `<head>` section to link external stylesheets. It specifies the relationship between the current document and the linked resource.

questions.question: How do you add inline CSS to an HTML element?
questions.explanation: Inline CSS is applied directly to an HTML element using the `style` attribute. This method is useful for applying unique styles to single elements, but it is generally not recommended for large-scale styling.

questions.question: What is the correct syntax for a CSS comment?
questions.explanation: CSS comments begin with `/*` and end with `*/`. They are used to add notes within the stylesheet that are ignored by the browser.

questions.question: Which CSS property is used to change the background color of an element?
questions.explanation: The `background-color` property is used to set the solid background color of an HTML element. While `background` is a shorthand property, `background-color` specifically targets the color.

questions.question: Which CSS selector is used to select elements by their ID?
questions.explanation: The `#` symbol is used in CSS to select an HTML element based on its unique `id` attribute. For example, `#myElement` will select the element with `id='myElement'`.

questions.question: What is the purpose of the 'margin' property in CSS?

options.A: To add space inside an element
options.B: To add space outside an element
options.C: To add a border to an element
options.D: To set the text color of an element

questions.explanation: The `margin` property is used to create space around elements, outside of any defined borders. It defines the distance between the element's border and adjacent elements.

questions.question: What is the CSS 'box model'?

options.A: A model that defines a structured box layout
options.B: A layout model based on tables
options.C: A model that describes the spacing around an element
options.D: A model that wraps elements in a 3D box

questions.explanation: The CSS box model is a fundamental concept that describes how elements are rendered on a page, treating each element as a rectangular box with content, padding, border, and margin layers.

questions.question: Which property is used to set the width of an element?
questions.explanation: The `width` property explicitly sets the horizontal dimension of an element's content area. This property is commonly used for defining the size of images, divs, and other block-level elements.

questions.question: What is the purpose of the 'padding' property in CSS?

options.A: To control the visibility of an element
options.B: To add space inside an element's border

questions.explanation: The `padding` property is used to generate space around an element's content, inside of any defined borders. It provides internal spacing, pushing the content away from the element's edges.

questions.question: Which CSS property is used to change the text color of an element?
questions.explanation: The `color` property is used to set the foreground color of an element's text content. It is a fundamental property for styling typography.

questions.explanation:
To select all `

questions.question: What is the purpose of the 'float' property in CSS?

options.D: To add padding around an element

questions.explanation: The `float` property positions an element to the left or right within its containing block, allowing text and inline elements to wrap around it. It is commonly used for creating multi-column layouts or aligning images within text.

questions.question: Which CSS property controls the visibility of an element?
questions.explanation: The `visibility` property controls whether an element is visible without affecting its layout. An element with `visibility: hidden;` will still occupy space on the page, unlike `display: none;` which removes it from the document flow entirely.

questions.question: What is the default value of the 'position' property in CSS?
questions.explanation: The default value of the `position` property is `static`. This means the element is positioned according to the normal flow of the document, and properties like `top`, `bottom`, `left`, and `right` have no effect.

questions.question: Which CSS property is used to add space between the content and border of an element?
questions.explanation: The `padding` property creates space between the element's content and its border. This internal spacing is part of the element's overall box model.

questions.question: How do you center an element horizontally in CSS?
questions.explanation: To horizontally center a block-level element, you set its `margin-left` and `margin-right` properties to `auto`. This works when the element has a defined width.

questions.question: Which property is used to change the font size of an element?
questions.explanation: The `font-size` property is used to specify the size of the text within an element. It can be set using various units like pixels, ems, rems, or percentages.

questions.question: How do you apply a style to an element when it is hovered over?
questions.explanation: The `:hover` pseudo-class selector is used to apply styles to an element only when the user's mouse pointer is hovering over it. This is commonly used for interactive effects.

questions.question: Which CSS property makes text bold?
questions.explanation: The `font-weight` property is used to set how thick or thin characters in text should be displayed. Setting it to `bold` (or a numerical value like 700) makes the text appear heavier.
